name: Komodo
fun_fact: Fun fact: Komodo dragons are the world's largest living lizards, growing up to 3 meters long and weighing 70kg - they can eat 80% of their body weight in one meal and have killed at least 4 humans since 1974!

hero_dishes.name: Ikan Bakar
hero_dishes.description: Grilled fresh fish with sambal, caught from the waters around Komodo
hero_dishes.origin_story: The Flores Sea provides incredible fresh fish - grilled simply with Indonesian spices
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Labuan Bajo restaurants, liveaboard boats, local warungs

hero_dishes.name: Sate Lilit
hero_dishes.description: Minced fish satay wrapped around lemongrass sticks
hero_dishes.origin_story: A variation from Bali and East Indonesia - the lemongrass infuses the fish
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Restaurants in Labuan Bajo, boat tours

hero_dishes.name: Ayam Taliwang
hero_dishes.description: Grilled chicken with spicy chili paste from nearby Lombok
hero_dishes.origin_story: A fiery specialty from the region - the bird is flattened and charred with sambal

hero_dishes.name: Cumi Cumi Goreng
hero_dishes.description: Fried squid with sambal, straight from local fishermen
hero_dishes.origin_story: Simple and fresh - the waters around Komodo are rich with squid

signature_drinks.name: Es Kelapa Muda
signature_drinks.description: Young coconut water with ice and coconut flesh
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Essential refreshment in the tropical heat

signature_drinks.name: Kopi Flores
signature_drinks.description: Coffee from Flores island - known for its complexity
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Strong and sweet in the morning

food_culture_notes: Labuan Bajo is the gateway town with best food options
Liveaboard boats serve meals while touring Komodo islands
Fresh seafood is the highlight - caught daily
Simple preparations let fresh ingredients shine
